column4: ok - Ubuntu Server coming in now and will use Rsync: thank you.

I have a bizarre issue, I pull out all hard drives, remove my Win7 drive and try and load Ubuntu to a new drive - for whatever reason I cant get the drive to boot - then I put back in my Windows 7 drive and I get a grub resuce error - now how is that even possible when the Windows 7 drive weas not even in the machine!????
it's because you have grub in MBR of win7's drive.
Xray - how in the world can that happen?  I have to run repair cd and type bootrex.ece /fixmbr to correct Win7
Xray how would that even happen - the Win 7 drive as not in the machine?
type the nick as it is, please. In other case highlighting does not work.
anyway, when you did install ubuntu, the first bootable drive was win7 drive. Therefore GRUB was installet there.
you can disconnect win7 drive and boot from ubuntu's cd or dvd
as far as I remember it have some repair functions there
when I tried to install Ubuntu - the windows 7 drive was out of the machine - I tried to load UBU on a new drive
did you installed GRUB to MBR?
the second thing you should to heck is bootable flag of partitions.
sorry, to check.

Xray:  Windows 7 working on drive-pull out drive - put in new drive - boot to live cd - try to install - install fails - remove new drive - put in windows 7 drive again - now win 7 wont boot - error about grub rescue - how in the world is that possible
not to "heck" XD
okay, you really did GRUB installation.
- I think you got it - I did recently enable raid
if the question is to boot win7, you should use fixboot and fixmbr
and check bootable flag.
I did fix win 7 my question is why is Grub loading to my raid I guess?  By the way my raid drives are disconnected
it should be set to the win7's service partition (usually ~100 mb)
you grub was installed when you tried installation, that failed.
